name: WebM video format
description: Multimedia format designed to provide a royalty-free, high-quality open video compression format for use with HTML5 video. WebM supports the video codec VP8 and VP9.

byNum.1: Older browser versions did not support all codecs.
byNum.2: Older Edge versions did not support progressive sources.
byNum.3: Can be enabled in Internet Explorer and Safari for MacOS by manually installing the codecs in the operating system.
byNum.5: Supports [VP9 codec used in WebRTC](https://webkit.org/blog/10929) (off by default.)
byNum.6: Supports [VP9 WebM used in MediaSource](https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=216652#c1) on [macOS Big Sur or later.](https://trac.webkit.org/changeset/264747/webkit)
byNum.7: Safari 14.1 â€“ 15.6 has full support of WebM, but requires macOS 11.3 Big Sur or later.
